page.title: 01The Quarry in Lighthorne:1
page.content: The quarry has existed from the start of this century.The stone they quarry is called oolitic limestone.The stone is sold to local builders for houses, extensions, garden walls, fireplaces, etc. The soft surface stone is used for hardcore, mainly in farm driveways, gateways and under farm buildings.The man at the quarry uses only one small excavator to dig out the stone.The walling stone is found in three uniform layers, 127mm, 102mm and 51mm thick.The walling stone is easier to handle in dry weather because it is picked out by hand. All the new houses in Lighthorne are built with oolitic limestone and a lot of the older houses would have been built with local stone too.The quarry is used regularly.
